image.altText: Peter Dutton looks down while delivering his concession speech

props.synopsis: The report, co-authored by Liberal grandees Pru Goward and Nick Minchin, has now been sent to a legal team to ensure it is watertight while the party decides what step to take next.

title.children: Liberal election autopsy delayed after Dutton suggests report defamatory

image.altText: Protesters gather in front of the US consulate during a demonstration in Nuuk

props.synopsis: Donald Trump announces the escalating tariffs for Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland as a row over Greenland continues.

title.children: Trump vows tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland stand-off

image.altText: A man in a suit gesturing

props.synopsis: Tehran is the epicentre of the nightly protests shaking Iran's regime, but the reverberations are being felt loud and clear in Moscow, too.

title.children: Putin's 'worst-case scenario' could be realised in Iran regime change

image.altText: Standing atop a pillar, men cheer as a statue of a horse tumbles down its side

props.synopsis: Protesters are urging US President Donald Trump to help dismantle Iran's theocracy. If he answers the call, it won't be the first time the US government has toppled an Iranian government.

title.children: This CIA plot has shaped the US relationship with Iran for decades

image.altText: Four people in yellow fire jackets stand in a row (two men, a woman and another man).

props.synopsis: The volunteer brigade from Terip Terip went through "hell" and back, narrowly escaping death, while fighting to save their own community and those nearby.

title.children: As a bushfire raged around them, a volunteer brigade made a plan to survive

image.altText: an illustration of surgeons seen through a boat's portal.

props.synopsis: On the largest civilian hospital ship in the world, Australian volunteers provide life-changing healthcare that is transforming lives.

title.children: Surgery on board a hospital ship gave Amara his childhood back

image.altText: A red BHP logo on a glass building in front of a grey sky

props.synopsis: The year is barely underway but already there's a power struggle between our biggest corporations as they fight it out for line honours.

title.children: BHP popular with investors as CWA loses its shine in market

image.altText: A gold statue of a blindfolded woman holding a set of scales.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Supreme Court trial is forging ahead with amended transcripts after an interpreter made more than 200 translation errors during a key witness' evidence.

title.children: Interpreter makes more than 200 errors in Supreme Court trial

image.altText: A large shark with grey top half and white bottom half near the ocean surface being hit by sun beams.

props.synopsis: Several shark species are on the move as waters warm along Australia’s east coast. Here's how climate change is affecting the range of three major species.

title.children: Sharks seek sea change as ocean temperatures rise

image.altText: A man taking a selfie with his wife and four daughters near a beach

props.synopsis: Experts on the benefit of charging board and expenses if you’re sharing a home with young adults, and how to calculate it.

title.children: Charging board or rent to adult children can help them and you

image.altText: Cars on a flooded road.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the Illawarra Highway near Clover Hill Road just before 4pm after a tree branch fell onto a passing vehicle on a busy road.

title.children: Woman dies after tree falls on her car as winds lash NSW coast

image.altText: a woman eats food with chopsticks in a cafeteria

props.synopsis: Camps offering intensive weight loss programs are on the rise in China as the country faces skyrocketing obesity rates.

title.children: Australian woman documents her stint in Chinese weight loss 'prison'

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, his hair ruffled by the wind, stands behind a lectern at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Albanese government will separate laws tightening gun control from its proposed hate speech reforms after the omnibus bill failed to secure the support of the Coalition and the Greens.

title.children: Labor to cut racial vilification offence from hate speech bill after Greens signal opposition

image.altText: people gather outside bondi pavilion for a memorial for the victims of the terrorist attack on december 14

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese unveils further details of the national day of mourning to be held on January 22 after last month's Bondi terrorist attack.

title.children: Australians urged to light a candle for Bondi victims on day of mourning

image.altText: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei speaking at a microphone.

props.synopsis: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has labelled Donald Trump a criminal, blaming him for the deaths of thousands of demonstrators and security forces.

title.children: Iran's leader Khamenei blames Trump for inciting deadly protests

image.altText: Woman in purple shirt sitting at table

props.synopsis: It started as a Facebook page and now it is a vital charity. Here is how this group run by grandmothers is fighting loneliness in the NSW Blue Mountains.

title.children: One woman's mission to heal a mining town in crisis

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Wow, you really don't quit. Let's see how poorly you perform this week.

title.children: New year, new you? Ha. Let’s play… HARD!

image.altText: People marching through the streets of Copenhagen under slogans 'Hands off Greenland'.

props.synopsis: Chanting "Greenland is not for sale" and carrying banners saying "Hands off Greenland", thousands of people have marched in Denmark, responding to US President Donald Trump's ambitions to acquire the Artic island.

title.children: Greenland is not for sale: thousands take to the streets of Denmark

image.altText: Sam Kerr smiles as she runs off in celebration of a goal for Chelsea

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr declares she is approaching her best form after scoring twice for Chelsea in a Women's FA Cup victory over Crystal Palace.

title.children: 'Back to my best': Kerr's comeback continues with FA Cup double

image.altText: a woman carries an aboriginal flag duirng an invasion day rally in 2024

props.synopsis: Lawyers, human rights advocates and civil libertarians are urging the NSW Police Commissioner not to extend a ban on authorised public assemblies as January 26 approaches.

title.children: Calls for NSW police to end protest restrictions before Australia Day rallies

image.altText: Two middle-aged men in suits stand awkwardly in a decorated room.

props.synopsis: The White House has released the names of leaders who will play a role in overseeing the next steps in Gaza, under the so-called "Board of Peace".

title.children: Trump appoints son-in-law Jared Kushner to new Gaza 'Board of Peace'

image.altText: Tim Walz is surrounded by  people at a public event in the US

props.synopsis: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz says the federal justice system is being weaponised to intimidate Donald Trump's perceived political enemies.

title.children: US Justice Department opens criminal investigation into Minnesota officials

image.altText: Flight tracker path PK-THT

props.synopsis: Search and rescue crews have been deployed to the mountainous area of Maros Regency to look for the plane.

title.children: Indonesian flight goes missing with 11 on board

image.altText: A glass ball is illuminated by golden sunlight.

props.synopsis: Geraldton's Horizon Ball sculpture is drawing huge crowds of tourists after the spot gained international attention on social media.

title.children: Crowds flock to beach sculpture to see the sun set upside down

image.altText: A truck is seen in front of a harden path, so signs of fire

props.synopsis: A grassfire tore through Natimuk in minutes, overwhelming warnings and emergency response. Experts say it signals a dangerous new phase of bushfires.

title.children: Security vision shows terrifying speed of a new kind of climate-driven fire

image.altText: John fenlon centre of a picture on holiday at the beach in roratonga.

props.synopsis: From February 25, dual citizens of the UK and Ireland will be required to enter the UK using a valid British or Irish passport, a change causing major headaches for dual citizens with imminent travel plans.

title.children: Passport rule change disrupts travel plans for thousands of Aussies

image.altText: A close up of a man half smiling wearing a dark blue cap

props.synopsis: Australian cricket great Damien Martyn has paid tribute to the support he has received during his remarkable recovery from meningitis, while revealing he was given a "50:50 chance" of surviving the illness.

title.children: 'I'm back!' Damien Martyn shares heartfelt update on remarkable recovery

image.altText: Novak Djokovic kisses the Australian Open trophy

props.synopsis: After two years stuck one shy of the all-time grand slam titles record, Novak Djokovic believes the Australian Open is as good a place as any to make his greatest piece of history.

title.children: Why Djokovic won't be burdened by grand slam record chase

image.altText: A SailGP boat featuring Bonds logos racing on water.

props.synopsis: SailGP debutant Sweden is locked in a three-way tie for the lead after the first day of racing in Fremantle, with the Australian boat Flying Roos well placed in fourth spot heading into Sunday's races.

title.children: Debutants impress, Australia well placed after SailGP Fremantle day one

image.altText: An older woman in an orange jumper and red beanie, with long brown hair and glasses, holding a book and speaking.

props.synopsis: After more than a century of silence, the Bunurong language is being brought back to life by elders, linguists and community.

title.children: New dictionary aims to 'awaken' language not spoken fluently for 100 years

image.altText: Back and shoulder of a police officer in uniform.

props.synopsis: Police charge members of the Bandidos outlaw motorcycle gang after an incident in Perth's southern suburbs on Friday evening that led to a section of the Kwinana Freeway being blocked.

title.children: 'Internal conflict' claims after 18 bikies arrested following freeway pursuit

image.altText: A computer generated image of a multi-storey glass building on the corner of two roads

props.synopsis: As the wrecking ball looms, a community battle is brewing over whether historic flour mill walls need to fall to make way for development.

title.children: Developer's bid to demolish 140-year-old flour mill walls faces backlash

image.altText: A small boat moored at a marina.

props.synopsis: Living at Brisbane’s Kangaroo Point overlooking the river would typically come with a hefty price tag, but some residents have found an alternative.

title.children: Renters swapping apartments for boats for inner-city living at $500 a week

image.altText: Machado Trump

props.synopsis: Lacking leverage with the United States, María Machado makes a calculated move to gift her Nobel Peace Prize to President Donald Trump. It underscores her willingness to think long-term.

title.children: Venezuela's opposition leader bets on a future with Trump

image.altText: Lance Armstrong holds his chin

props.synopsis: Lance Armstrong had successfully doped for years. But when the evidence backed him into a corner he took control of the narrative and confessed live on Oprah's couch, martyring himself to cycling's EPO era.

title.children: Lance Armstong destroyed his legacy with five monosyllabic answers to Oprah
